description.narrative: Project Support, which contributes to Data And Child Protection, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: A child protection system established in 3 districts and documented to inform a national child protection system

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF GENDER CHILDREN AND SOCIAL WELFARE

sector.narrative: Administrative data and Information Management System (IMS) including CPIMS+, GBVIMS+, MRMIMS+
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Violence, exploitation, and abuse - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration

title.narrative: Malawi United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Description of UNICEF programming approach framework at the country level with Common Country Assessments (CCAs) providing the equivalence of pre project appraisals
Interagency Humanitarian Response Assessments and Plans
UN Sustainable Development Group Database of Common Country Analyses
UNINFO Document Database to search for Common Country Analysis and Cooperation Framework
UNICEF Policy on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF procedure for programme implementation partnerships

2018 Malawi Evaluation of Malawi Child Protection Strategy 2012 to 2018
Malawi 2021 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: A Child Protection Information management System (CPIMS) that tracks victims and survivors of violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect in place by 2014 (2011: No, 2014: Yes)
